title: 97C.371 SPEARING FISH.
text:
Only common carp, native rough fish, catfish, lake whitefish, cisco (tullibee), and northern pike may be taken by spearing.
Catfish, lake whitefish, cisco (tullibee), and northern pike may be speared only from dark houses.
A person may not take fish by angling or the use of tip-ups while spearing fish in a dark house, except that a person may take fish by angling if only one angling line is in use and any fish caught by angling is immediately released to the water or placed on the ice.
The open season for spearing through the ice is November 15 through the last Sunday in February.
Nonresidents may spear from a fish house or dark house.
